meanings.definition: Not allowing fluid to pass through.
meanings.sent1: The rubber material is impermeable to water.
meanings.sent2: The raincoat is impermeable, keeping the wearer dry in the storm.
meanings.sent3: The impermeable barrier held back the flood, much to the relief of the town.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was impermeable, like a fortress against doubt.
meanings.sent5: The impermeable seal on the bottle kept the soda fizzy for days.

meanings.definition: Not allowing air or water to pass through.
meanings.sent1: The impermeable plastic wrap sealed the food container tightly.
meanings.sent2: The diver wore an impermeable suit to stay warm underwater.
meanings.sent3: The impermeable umbrella shielded her from both rain and wind.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt impermeable to the harsh words, like a shield of steel.
meanings.sent5: The impermeable wall blocked out all sounds from the construction site.

meanings.definition: Not allowing light to pass through.
meanings.sent1: The impermeable curtains kept the room dark for a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent2: The sunglasses had impermeable lenses to protect the eyes from UV rays.
meanings.sent3: The impermeable shadow seemed to have a mind of its own, following him everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like an impermeable fog, obscuring any clarity.
meanings.sent5: The impermeable armor of the knight gleamed in the sunlight, blinding his enemies.
